1.name: Gold
1.extraTooltipInfo: Gold is used to purchase items from the market and shops. You can get more gold by selling resources or fighting monsters.

2.name: Heat
2.extraTooltipInfo: Heat is used to smelt bars and cook food. You can get heat by burning various items such as logs, branches and coal.

3.name: Air Essence
3.extraTooltipInfo: Air Essence can be gathered by waiting patiently.

4.name: Earth Essence
4.extraTooltipInfo: Earth Essence can be gathered while mining.

5.name: Fire Essence
5.extraTooltipInfo: Fire Essence can be gathered while smithing or cooking.

6.name: Water Essence
6.extraTooltipInfo: Water Essence can be gathered by fishing.

7.name: Blood Essence
7.extraTooltipInfo: Blood Essence can be gathered by dealing damage.

8.name: Death Essence
8.extraTooltipInfo: Death Essence can be gathered by killing opponents.

9.name: Chaos Essence
9.extraTooltipInfo: Chaos Essence can be gathered by attempting to hit an enemy.

10.name: Nature Essence
10.extraTooltipInfo: Nature Essence can be gathered by foraging and farming.

11.name: Mind Essence
11.extraTooltipInfo: Mind Essence can be gathered by enchanting and augmenting items.

12.name: Cosmic Essence
12.extraTooltipInfo: Cosmic Essence can be gathered by enchanting or runecrafting.

20.name: Platinum
20.extraTooltipInfo: Platinum is used to purchase items from the Platinum Shop.

50.name: Book
50.extraTooltipInfo: A dusty tome. Perhaps I should read it?

60.name: Raw Shrimp
60.extraTooltipInfo: S h r i m p

61.name: Raw Anchovy
61.extraTooltipInfo: In what scape would these look like blue shrimp?

63.name: Raw Salmon
63.extraTooltipInfo: Not going up any rivers anymore.

66.name: Raw Shark
66.extraTooltipInfo: A big toothy fish. It's a fish, right?

67.name: Raw Megalodon
67.extraTooltipInfo: A monstrously large shark with incredibly tough meat.

68.name: Raw Ancient Lobster
68.extraTooltipInfo: A mean looking and monstrously heavy lobster. It's definitely a lot older than you are.

69.name: Raw Tentacle Meat
69.extraTooltipInfo: A massive chunk of ancient rubbery meat torn from some sort of tentacled monster.

72.name: Raw Magnetic Minnow
72.extraTooltipInfo: It didn't even bite the hook, it just got stuck to it.

73.name: Raw Tigerfish
73.extraTooltipInfo: Mean looking and strong to boot!

75.name: Raw Great White Shark
75.extraTooltipInfo: A deadly creature to be sure.

76.name: Raw Hammerhead Shark
76.extraTooltipInfo: Probably can't actually be used as a hammer.

77.name: Raw Crab
77.extraTooltipInfo: In some places it's considered less desirable than lobster, but not here.

95.name: Burnt Fish
95.extraTooltipInfo: The result of an overzealous cook. Perhaps studying this will make you a better cook?

96.name: Burnt Food
96.extraTooltipInfo: The result of an overzealous cook. Perhaps studying this will make you a better cook?

101.name: Copper Ore
101.extraTooltipInfo: Can be smelted into bronze bars with the help of some tin.

102.name: Tin Ore
102.extraTooltipInfo: Can be smelted into bronze bars with the help of some copper.

103.name: Iron Ore
103.extraTooltipInfo: Can be smelted into the most basic of basic metal bars, iron.

104.name: Gold Ore
104.extraTooltipInfo: A large chunk of gold ready to be smelted into a bar.

105.name: Mithril Ore
105.extraTooltipInfo: A dark blue tinted and hardy metal that can be smelted into bars.

106.name: Adamantite Ore
106.extraTooltipInfo: A green hued metal most consider nearly worthless that can be smelted into bars.

107.name: Runite Ore
107.extraTooltipInfo: One of the hardest naturally occuring metals that may be smelted into tough bars.

108.name: Clay
108.extraTooltipInfo: It may not be what plants crave, but you could probably mix this with sand to make fertilizer.

110.name: Sand
110.extraTooltipInfo: Some particularly nutritious sand can be used to create fertilizer, though eating the sand itself doesn't seem like a good idea...

111.name: Silver
111.extraTooltipInfo: A great material for channeling magic essence.

112.name: Coal
112.extraTooltipInfo: Burn it up to make heat! It's okay, the industrial revolution hasn't happened yet so you're safe from environmental activists.

114.name: Stygian Ore
114.extraTooltipInfo: An unnaturally glittering ore sourced from the deepest of delves. May be smelted into bars with the aid of ichor.

115.name: Void Stone
115.extraTooltipInfo: A stone pulsing with chaotic energy.

150.name: Fertilizer
150.extraTooltipInfo: Stinky sack of nutrients. Makes plants grow faster.
150.craftingDescription: Stinky sack of nutrients. Makes plants grow faster. Crafts in batches of 4.

177.name: Elder Tree Seed
177.extraTooltipInfo: Every type of forest can be traced back to one of these trees.

180.name: Sageberry Bush Seed
180.extraTooltipInfo: It may be wise to plant this.

185.name: Mysterious Seed
185.craftingDescription: The blessing of life steeped in the ooze of corruption. This will have a random size when created.
185.extraTooltipInfo: Life is not necessarily the opposite of corruption. I wonder what this could grow into?

202.name: Iron Bar
202.extraTooltipInfo: May be used to craft iron equipment or to augment obsidian gear.

203.name: Gold Bar
203.extraTooltipInfo: May be used to craft or augment jewelry. Sadly you aren't authorized to create your own currency.

204.name: Mithril Bar
204.extraTooltipInfo: May be used to craft mithril equipment or to augment obsidian gear.

205.name: Adamantite Bar
205.extraTooltipInfo: A rather limited, yet hard, metal. May only be used to create Adamantite gear.

206.name: Runite Bar
206.extraTooltipInfo: One of the toughest natural metals. May be used to craft Runite equipment.

207.name: Stygian Bar
207.extraTooltipInfo: An unnaturally tough metal that is almost crystalline in nature. May be used to craft Stygian equipment.

208.name: Chaotic Crystal
208.extraTooltipInfo: A condensed crystal formed through processing a large amount of void stones. May be used to craft or enhance unique equipment.

209.name: Obsidian Glass
209.extraTooltipInfo: A splinter of mildly reflective obsidian glass.

9006.name: Torn Goblin Settlement Map
9006.craftingDescription: Grants one-time access to the Goblin Settlement dungeon. This is a trio encounter.
9006.extraTooltipInfo: A map to find an elusive goblin settlement. You could probably only bring up to three people to this location safely.

9007.name: Scrap of Stained Parchment
9007.extraTooltipInfo: A scrap of parchment that appears to be a part of a map.

9008.name: Dark Fortress Key
9008.craftingDescription: Grants one-time access to the Dark Fortress dungeon. This is a trio encounter.
9008.extraTooltipInfo: A brutish key made of dark metal. The way to a fortress is treacherous, no more than three people could make the journey.

9009.name: Dark Key Piece
9009.extraTooltipInfo: A piece of dark metal that looks like part of a key.

9010.name: Cursed Spade
9010.craftingDescription: Bringing the pieces together makes them emit a sickly pallor. Is it worth reassembling it?
9010.extraTooltipInfo: A cursed spade that is drawn to long forgotten lands...

9011.name: Burning Feather
9011.craftingDescription: Grants one-time access to the Palace of Flames dungeon. This is a duo encounter.
9011.extraTooltipInfo: The feather itself appears to be made out of fire! You could probably lead yourself and one other wherever it's pointing. It just wants to go home, but you'd probably melt in there. Better bring some Flame Resistance food!

9012.name: Krampus' Key
9012.extraTooltipInfo: A piece of bone with some bits of metal sticking off of it. If you squint really hard it somewhat resembles a key.

9013.name: Molten Ashes
9013.extraTooltipInfo: The remains of some infernal creature. Still warm to the touch.

9014.name: Infernal Flame
9014.extraTooltipInfo: The vestiges of an infernal soul, left to burn eternally.

9015.name: Cracked Shrimp Bauble
9015.extraTooltipInfo: The roar of the ocean can be heard faintly while examining this bauble.

9016.name: Elder Lockstone
9016.craftingDescription: Repairing the lockstone appears to activate some sort of latent power within it.
9016.extraTooltipInfo: A lockstone that can lead its owner to a hidden Elder Ruin and reveal its untouched treasures.

9017.name: Castle Map
9017.craftingDescription: A full map that leads to an old castle.
9017.extraTooltipInfo: A full map that leads to an old castle.

9018.name: Eye of the Storm key
9018.craftingDescription: A full map that leads to an old castle.
9018.extraTooltipInfo: A full map that leads to an old castle.

9019.name: The Maelstrom key
9019.craftingDescription: A full map that leads to an old castle.
9019.extraTooltipInfo: A full map that leads to an old castle.

10001.name: Useless Scraps
10001.extraTooltipInfo: Perhaps you could salvage something dextrous from these scraps...

10002.name: Useless Scraps
10002.extraTooltipInfo: Perhaps you could salvage something intellectual from these scraps...

10003.name: Gem Package
10003.extraTooltipInfo: A bag of gems! I wonder what's inside? ...Gems, hopefully.

10004.name: Sealed Scroll
10004.extraTooltipInfo: A sealed scroll. Doesn't come with postal information, so I guess it's yours now! What could its contents be?

10005.name: Small Gathering Supply Crate
10005.extraTooltipInfo: A small crate addressed to someone named 'Diet$melter.' Sounds like a fake name, you should open it!

10006.name: Gathering Supply Crate
10006.extraTooltipInfo: A crate addressed to someone named 'Diet$melter.' Sounds like a fake name, you should open it!

10007.name: Large Gathering Supply Crate
10007.extraTooltipInfo: A large crate addressed to someone named 'Diet$melter.' Sounds like a fake name, you should open it!

10008.name: Bucket of Worms
10008.extraTooltipInfo: A bucket of soil with worms inside! At least it isn't just a can of worms!

10009.name: Box of Skill Books
10009.extraTooltipInfo: An ornate lockbox containing a variety of skill books. Testing Item.

11000.name: Novice Tacklebox
11000.craftingDescription: A novice fishing tacklebox. Gives 3 fishing levels, 15 bait power and 5 reel power.
11000.extraTooltipInfo: A beginner's novice tacklebox designed to be used by children. Not much good to catch anything large.

11001.name: Basic Tacklebox
11001.craftingDescription: A basic fishing tacklebox. Gives 6 fishing levels, 20 bait power, 10 reel power, and 3 bonus rarity.
11001.extraTooltipInfo: A basic fishing tacklebox aimed for use by hobbyists and amateurs for basic fishing adventures to the local river or pond.

11002.name: Advanced Tacklebox
11002.craftingDescription: An advanced fishing tacklebox. Gives 9 fishing levels, 25 bait power, 15 reel power, and 6 bonus rarity.
11002.extraTooltipInfo: An advanced fishing tacklebox for those who've gotten more than their toes wet in fishing.

11003.name: Pro Tacklebox
11003.craftingDescription: A pro fishing tacklebox! Gives 12 fishing levels, 30 bait power, 20 reel power, and 10 bonus rarity.
11003.extraTooltipInfo: The pro fishing tacklebox has nearly everything you could possibly need to catch fish.

11004.name: Supreme Tacklebox
11004.craftingDescription: A supreme fishing tacklebox! Gives 15 fishing levels, 35 bait power, 25 reel power, and 15 bonus rarity.
11004.extraTooltipInfo: A supreme fishing tacklebox rife with all the bits and bobs a master fisherman would need to fish up just about anything.

11005.name: Ocean's Embrace
11005.craftingDescription: The ultimate fishing implement! Gives 40 fishing levels, 100 bait power, 100 reel power, and 60 bonus rarity. Enhances ancient fishing.
11005.extraTooltipInfo: The origin of this mythical equipment is lost to history but there is no doubt regarding its power. Enhances ancient fishing.

11015.name: Smelly Meat Bait
11015.extraTooltipInfo: Some smelly, probably not rotten, meat.

11016.name: Hardened Hook Bait
11016.extraTooltipInfo: A hook designed to make reeling in big catches easier.

11017.name: Alluring Lure Bait
11017.extraTooltipInfo: A shiny lure designed to entice even the most wary catches.

11018.name: Writhing Tentacle Bait
11018.craftingDescription: Each craft results in 6 bait. A writhing tentacle that reacts when you poke it. Enhances ancient fishing.
11018.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient writhing tentacle that reacts when you poke it. Enhances ancient fishing.

11019.name: Mysterious Bait
11019.extraTooltipInfo: Who knows what effects using this bait would have? Each and every one of them is unique!

11030.name: Rotten Driftwood
11030.extraTooltipInfo: A rotten piece of driftwood. Could it still be used for something?

11031.name: Sturdy Driftwood
11031.extraTooltipInfo: A sturdy piece of driftwood. Could it still be used for something?

11032.name: Aquamarine
11032.extraTooltipInfo: An aquamarine crystal. If you hold it up to your ear you can look like an idiot!

11033.name: Ancient Fishing Rod
11033.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient fishing rod, straight out of a madman's fantasy. Not much good on its own in this condition; it would take a master crafter to repair it...

11034.name: Ancient Harpoon
11034.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient harpoon, probably dragged up from some ancient aquatic ruin. Not much good on its own in this condition; it would take a master crafter to repair it...

11035.name: Ancient Fishing Net
11035.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient fishing net, the material it's made out of appears to be alive. Not much good on its own in this condition; it would take a master crafter to repair it...

11036.name: Mystical Driftwood
11036.extraTooltipInfo: An oddly glowing piece of driftwood. Could it still be used for something?

12000.name: Fisherman's Smock
12000.extraTooltipInfo: A smock for fishing! You can already feel it making your tools stronger.

12001.name: Fisherman's Bucket Hat
12001.extraTooltipInfo: A hat for fishing! You can already feel it making your reflexes sharper.

12002.name: Fisherman's Waders
12002.extraTooltipInfo: Waders for fishing! You can already feel it making your ability to bait fish stronger.

12003.name: Miner's Smock
12003.extraTooltipInfo: A smock for fishing! You can already feel it making your tools stronger.

12004.name: Miner's Lantern Helmet
12004.extraTooltipInfo: OSHA improved! Let's you see better! Wow!

12005.name: Miner's Trousers
12005.extraTooltipInfo: Waders for fishing! You can already feel it making your ability to bait fish stronger.

12006.name: Lumberjack's Vest
12006.extraTooltipInfo: A smock for fishing! You can already feel it making your tools stronger.

12007.name: Lumberjack's Hat
12007.extraTooltipInfo: A hat for fishing! You can already feel it making your reflexes sharper.

12008.name: Lumberjack's Trousers
12008.extraTooltipInfo: Waders for fishing! You can already feel it making your ability to bait fish stronger.

12009.name: Fishing Shard
12009.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12010.name: Mining Shard
12010.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12011.name: Foraging Shard
12011.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12012.name: Prismatic Dust
12012.extraTooltipInfo: A fine dust that radiates a prismatic luster; formed when too much power is imbued into a Black Opal

13000.name: Combat Manual - Volume 1
13000.extraTooltipInfo: A manual on how to take advantage of your weapon's edge. Apparently using the sharp part means it will hurt something more, who could have known?

13001.name: Combat Manual - Volume 2
13001.extraTooltipInfo: A manual on how to take poke things really good. If the weapon has a decent tip, you can stab things! Wow!

13002.name: Combat Manual - Volume 3
13002.extraTooltipInfo: A manual on how to just hit things hard. Crushing things is deceptively simple and to truly pummel your enemy you must understand that being blunt is sometimes the only way to go.

13003.name: Spell Tome - Fire Ball
13003.extraTooltipInfo: A basic tome from the Academy formerly used for teaching aspiring mages how to control and utilize fire. Be careful where you practice it!

13004.name: Spell Tome - Flamethrower
13004.extraTooltipInfo: An intermediate tome from the Academy formerly used for teaching mages how to utilize flames in a more lively manner.

13005.name: Ballistics 101
13005.extraTooltipInfo: A textbook that explains the basic principles regarding how something that goes up usually comes back down.

13006.name: Projectile Based Diplomacy - I
13006.extraTooltipInfo: A book that outline the merits of using projectiles, preferably several at once, to really get your point across.

13007.name: Projectile Based Diplomacy - II
13007.extraTooltipInfo: A book that outline the merits of using projectiles, even just a single well placed one, to really get your point across.

13008.name: Projectile Based Diplomacy - III
13008.extraTooltipInfo: A book that outline the merits of using projectiles, especially when trying to distract and divert, to really get your point across.

13009.name: Apocalyptic Tome
13009.extraTooltipInfo: A spell tome that contains the necessary rituals and rites for summoning your own miniature apocalypse.

13010.name: Intermediate Combat Manual - Volume 1
13010.extraTooltipInfo: A manual on how to hit two enemies at once in one swing.

15000.name: Slayer's Mark
15000.extraTooltipInfo: A type of trophy taken from a slain foe.

15001.name: Token of Ownership
15001.extraTooltipInfo: A token representing that some item was obtained.

15002.name: Token of Action
15002.extraTooltipInfo: A token representing that some action was completed.

25000.name: Monster Tooth
25000.extraTooltipInfo: A tooth taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25001.name: Monster Horn
25001.extraTooltipInfo: A horn taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25002.name: Sturdy Horn
25002.extraTooltipInfo: A sturdy horn taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25003.name: Old Coins
25003.extraTooltipInfo: Some old coins. Might be worth something to a collector

25004.name: Primitive Coin
25004.extraTooltipInfo: A rather heavy, yet primitive, gold coin. This could easily be sold for a tidy sum.

25005.name: Undead Token
25005.extraTooltipInfo: Some sort of token taken from the undead. Someone might be interested in it.

25006.name: Woodland Trinket
25006.extraTooltipInfo: A trinket taken from the Elves; might be worth something to someone.

25007.name: Intact Wing
25007.extraTooltipInfo: A mostly intact wing. Someone might be interested in it.

25008.name: Ornate Trinket
25008.extraTooltipInfo: A rather ornate trinket; it should be worth a bit.

25009.name: Useless Metal Scraps
25009.extraTooltipInfo: Useless metal scraps made from some poor quality material. Could probably be sold to someone for cheap.

25010.name: Exotic Trinket
25010.extraTooltipInfo: An exotic trinket from some unknown origin. Should be worth quite a bit to the right person.

25011.name: Demonic Statue
25011.extraTooltipInfo: A statue made from some sort of gem-like material depicting a small demon. May be worth quite a bit if you can find a buyer.

25012.name: Monster Claws
25012.extraTooltipInfo: Claws taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25013.name: Bottled Blood
25013.extraTooltipInfo: Slightly magical blood taken from something. May be valuable to someone.

25014.name: Broken Armaments
25014.extraTooltipInfo: Shattered pieces of equipment that probably is not worth salvaging by you; perhaps someone else may want to buy it.

25015.name: Creature Eggs
25015.extraTooltipInfo: Eggs from some creature. Probably best to get rid of this quickly.

25016.name: Dwarven Coins
25016.extraTooltipInfo: Shiny dwarven coins that are of no use to you. A vendor could exchange the currency.

25017.name: Bone Shards
25017.extraTooltipInfo: Splinters of bone taken from a slain creature. Might be worth something to someone.

25018.name: Giant Heart
25018.extraTooltipInfo: A giant heart, probably taken from a giant or similarly large creature. Superstitious suggests makinga meal with it will increase your attractiveness, but sadly that would mean nothing to you.

25019.name: Ancient Armor Scraps
25019.extraTooltipInfo: Scraps of some ancient piece of equipment. Its origin is unknown, but it may be worth something to the right person.

25020.name: Unknown Rune
25020.extraTooltipInfo: It appears to be a rune not created through conventional means. It is no use to you but someone may want it.

25021.name: Light Armor Scraps
25021.extraTooltipInfo: Pieces of light armor that is too damaged to salvage. Might be worth something to someone.

25022.name: Armor Scraps
25022.extraTooltipInfo: Pieces of armor that is too damaged to salvage. Might be worth something to someone.

25023.name: Heavy Armor Scraps
25023.extraTooltipInfo: Pieces of heavy armor that is too damaged to salvage. Might be worth something to someone.

25024.name: Tusk
25024.extraTooltipInfo: A tusk taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25025.name: Gem Shards
25025.extraTooltipInfo: Useless pieces of shattered gems. Not quite fine enough to be considered dust, but too small for you to properly refine or cut. Might be worth something to a vendor.

25026.name: Goblin Fork
25026.extraTooltipInfo: A useless eating utensil used by goblins. Everyone knows you should just eat your meals whole! A vendor may want this.

25027.name: Nature Stone
25027.extraTooltipInfo: A chunk of stone that appears to be imbued with life. Useless to you, but must be valuable to someone.

25028.name: Fire Stone
25028.extraTooltipInfo: A chunk of stone that appears to be imbued with flame. Useless to you, but must be valuable to someone.

25029.name: Ice Stone
25029.extraTooltipInfo: A chunk of stone that appears to be imbued with ice. Useless to you, but must be valuable to someone.

25030.name: A Diamond Plated Bug
25030.extraTooltipInfo: I wonder who added this in?

100000.name: ban_hamer
100000.extraTooltipInfo: with this hammer you can play whac-a-mole more efficiently
